messages.subject: Re: Sang, and the list in general
messages.msgSnippet: ... That s good! Thanks-also appologies to everyone for forgetting to put a subject title in my intro! It was late, and I ll claim extreme tiredness! :~)
messages.messageBody:
--- In UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com, SandraDodd@a... wrote:
> So anyway, you can bring up any topic no matter how old. <g>
> Go for it!
>
> Sandra

That's good! Thanks-also appologies to everyone for forgetting to put
a "subject" title in my intro! It was late, and I'll claim extreme
tiredness! :~)

Sang

messages.subject: Sang, and the list in general
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/20/04 10:22:41 AM, Sanguinegirl83@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/20/04 10:22:41 AM, Sanguinegirl83@... writes:

<< I'm up to April 3rd, now, and MAN, I wish I could

re-visit some posts! LOL >>

It wouldn't hurt a thing for you to comment on things that are a month or a
year old. There are people reading who are at all stages of considerations.

-=-This group really seems close-knit and the caring and support you show
each

other is something I really like. -=-

No way 1500 people are a close-knit group! I think there are people who feel
an affection for and interest in others who have proven their deep and honest
interest in figuring out how unschooling does and doesn't work. Some people
here have met each other at conferences. Some are e-mail buddies, but there
are lots of people here whose list-voices I really like yet we'll probably
never meet in person. That's okay. We're still involved in working together in a
volunteer-work kind of way, and that's a bond. Just like you can really like
someone you're spending an EarthDay cleanup afternoon with, and have lunch
together and then be content to never see each other afterwards, there are
people whose only connection is they had a really good time learning about
unschooling together.

That's okay.

So anyway, you can bring up any topic no matter how old. <g>
Go for it!

Sandra
